wikipedia_page.main: Russell Aldridge (5 August 1831 – 27 August 1895) was an English first-class cricketer. Born at Christchurch, Hampshire, Aldridge made a single appearance in first-class cricket for the Marylebone Cricket Club against the Sussex in 1855 at E. Tredcroft's Ground, Horsham, scoring 3 runs during the match, which was won by Sussex. He died at St Pancras, London.
